newsitem.title: TAIWAN: China Airlines applies for bond issue.
newsitem.headline: China Airlines applies for bond issue.

text.p: Taiwan carrier China Airlines said on Thursday it had applied to the Securities and Exchange Commission to issue T$3.5 billion in seven-year convertible bonds to raise funds for aircraft purchases.
The issue is China Airlines' first of convertible bonds, a company statement said.
In May, the airline signed contracts to buy eight Boeing 747-400s at a total cost of US$1.4 billion.
